question.title: {"sections": [{"spans": [{"text": "Would the UK be a really wonderful place without its infamous Class System?", "modifiers": {}}], "indent": 0, "quoted": false, "type": "plain", "is_rtl": false}]}

answer.content: {"sections": [{"spans": [{"text": "Living in Hong Kong was a big eye opener for me. On this basis I concluded that I was right to think what I previous thought, which was:", "modifiers": {}}], "indent": 0, "quoted": false, "type": "plain", "is_rtl": false}, {"spans": [{"text": "Britain does not have much of a class system. It is far more obsessed with the notion of itself as having a class system, than it is with any actual class system", "modifiers": {}}], "indent": 0, "quoted": false, "type": "unordered-list", "is_rtl": false}, {"spans": [{"text": "Britain does not have a problem with racism. That\u2019s not to say racist Britons don\u2019t exist. It means that there is nothing particularly about Britain, that is racist.", "modifiers": {}}], "indent": 0, "quoted": false, "type": "unordered-list", "is_rtl": false}, {"spans": [{"text": "Hong Kong society on the other hand, has a much more hierarchical class system than Britain. It also discriminates, entirely unflinchingly, on the basis of race. What\u2019s more, it\u2019s utterly un-selfconscious about both. Its racial and class hierarchy is explicit, universally acknowledged, and entirely unapologetic.", "modifiers": {}}], "indent": 0, "quoted": false, "type": "plain", "is_rtl": false}, {"spans": [{"text": "I spoke to a Japanese friend about this, who was asking me about my reflections on life in Hong Kong. I said, the first thing everyone wanted to know was, \u201cwhat race are you?\u201d She told me \u201call Asian countries are like that. The idea that your race doesn\u2019t matter is a Western idea. It doesn\u2019t exist in Asia\u201d. The second thing they wanted to know was \u201chow much money do you have?\u201d She told me \u201cthat\u2019s peculiarly Hong Kong\u201d.", "modifiers": {}}], "indent": 0, "quoted": false, "type": "plain", "is_rtl": false}, {"spans": [{"text": "Britain is probably the most stridently egalitarian and class-structure-lacking countries I\u2019ve ever seen. Yet the peculiar thing is, it still obsesses over itself, as if it has a class structure.", "modifiers": {}}], "indent": 0, "quoted": false, "type": "plain", "is_rtl": false}, {"spans": [{"text": "I\u2019ve come to the conclusion over the years, that Britain\u2019s relationship with the idea of a \u201cclass structure\u201d is a peculiar and complex one. It\u2019s more about what people think other people think, than what those mythical \u201cother\u201d people actually do think.", "modifiers": {}}], "indent": 0, "quoted": false, "type": "plain", "is_rtl": false}, {"spans": [{"text": "Would Britain be a really wonderful place without its \u201cinfamous\u201d class system? Well, my answer to this is, it is a really wonderful place and it doesn\u2019t have much of a class system.", "modifiers": {}}], "indent": 0, "quoted": false, "type": "plain", "is_rtl": false}]}
